contentrichtext.text: {{Other places3|Kensington station (disambiguation)}} {{Use dmy dates|date=January 2012}} {{Use Australian English|date=January 2012}} {{Infobox station | name = Kensington | type = | style = Melbourne | image = Kensington-Station-Melbourne.jpg | image_caption = | address = Macaulay Road/Bellair Street, Kensington, Victoria, 3031 | country = | coordinates = {{coord|-37.7939|144.9307|format=dms|type:railwaystation_region:AU-VIC|display=inline,title}} | line = <!-- line information is detailed under "services" --> | other = | structure = | platform = 2 | depth = | levels = | tracks = 2 | parking = | bicycle = | baggage_check = | opened = | closed = | rebuilt = | electrified = | ADA = | code = KEN | owned = [[VicTrack]] | operator = | zone = | smartcardname = [[Myki]] zone | smartcardstatus = <span style="color:goldenrod;">1</span> | status = Unmanned station | former = | passengers = | pass_year = | pass_percent = | pass_system = | mpassengers = | services = {{s-rail|title=Metro Trains}} {{s-line|system=Victoria|line=Craigieburn|previous=North Melbourne|next=Newmarket|rows1=2}} {{s-line|system=Victoria|line=Flemington|previous=North Melbourne|next=Newmarket|hide1=yes}} | map_locator = [http://maps.google.com.au/maps?q=Kensington,+Victoria&hl=en&ll=-37.793694,144.930568&spn=0.004604,0.009645&sll=-37.653111,145.028114&sspn=0.009225,0.01929&vpsrc=6&hnear=Kensington+Victoria&t=m&z=17 Link] | Melway = [http://www.street-directory.com.au/sd3/map.php?x=144.9305431789115&y=-37.7938169447328&l=13&mt=4 Link] | web = [http://ptv.vic.gov.au/stop/view/20041 Link, includes timetables] }} '''Kensington''' is a [[railway station]] in [[Melbourne]], [[Victoria (Australia)|Victoria]], [[Australia]], located in the suburb of [[Kensington, Victoria|Kensington]], on the [[Craigieburn railway line]]. Kensington is unmanned and is in [[Myki]] <span style="color:goldenrod;">Zone 1</span>. ==Station overview== ===Facilities=== Kensington is located at the northern end of the Macaulay Road level crossing, with station access from Macaulay Road and Eastwood Street. The station consists of two [[side platform]]s; Platform 1 has a large red brick building, while platform 2 has a smaller red brick building. [[Myki]] ticket vending machines are located at the entrances to platform 1 and platform 2. [[Metcard]] ticket vending machines were previously installed on both platforms but were removed in 2012, prior to the decommissioning of Metcard. A [[signal box]] is located at the [[Flinders Street Station|Flinders Street]] end of the station, as well a [[rail siding|siding]], used for the nearby [[grain silo]]s.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.vicsig.net/index.php?page=infrastructure&name=Kensington |title=VICSIG - Infrastructure - Kensington |publisher=www.vicsig.net |accessdate=2008-12-24 }}</ref> Special services to [[Flemington Racecourse railway station|Flemington Racecourse]] and [[Showgrounds railway station, Melbourne|Showgrounds]] stations run though the station, but do not stop for passengers with signs on the platform advising customers of the fact. ===History=== Kensington station opened on 1 November 1860 as part of the private [[Melbourne and Essendon Railway Company]] line to [[Essendon railway station|Essendon]]. The station closed with the line in 1864 until it was reopened in 1871 under government ownership.<ref>{{cite book | last = Turton | first = Keith W. | title = Six And A Half Inches From Destiny. The first hundred years of the Melbourne-Wodonga Railway 1873-1973. | publisher = Australian Railway Historical Society (Victorian Division) | year = 1973 | isbn = 0-85849-012-9 | page = 23 }}</ref> The Melbourne bound station building was constructed in 1886, as was the [[signal box]] beside the Kensington Road level crossing. The gates at the crossing were replaced by boom barriers in 1966.<ref>{{cite book | last = Turton | first = Keith W. | title = Six And A Half Inches From Destiny. The first hundred years of the Melbourne-Wodonga Railway 1873-1973. | publisher = Australian Railway Historical Society (Victorian Division) | year = 1973 | isbn = 0-85849-012-9 | page = 86 }}</ref> ===Platforms=== '''Platform 1:''' *Suburban [[Metro Trains Melbourne|Metro Trains]] services to Flinders Street. '''Platform 2:''' *Suburban Metro Trains services to [[Craigieburn railway station|Craigieburn]]. ==References== {{reflist}} [[Category:Railway stations in Melbourne]] [[Category:Railway stations opened in 1860]] [[Category:Rail freight terminals in Victoria (Australia)]] {{Melbourne-rail-stub}}
